senses.de: To remove something from where it is kept
senses.ex: Can you take out the trash for me, please?

Tips.title: Common Chores
Tips.description: Used for everyday tasks around the house or workplace.
Tips.example: Remember to take out the compost when it's full.

Tips.title: Physically Remove
Tips.description: Implies physically moving something from one place to another.
Tips.example: She took out the old magazines from the shelf.

senses.de: To buy food or a meal from a restaurant to eat it somewhere else
senses.ex: I'm too tired to cook tonight, let's take out pizza.

Tips.title: Casual Dining
Tips.description: Used when there's no desire or time to prepare food.
Tips.example: It's game night, so we'll just take out burgers.

Tips.title: Eating Elsewhere
Tips.description: Indicates the intent to eat the meal in a different location than the purchase place.
Tips.example: Let's take out sushi and eat at the park.

senses.de: To kill or destroy something or someone
senses.ex: The sniper was ordered to take out the enemy commander.

Tips.title: Action Movies
Tips.description: Commonly used in action or military contexts in films or books.
Tips.example: The agent was told to take out the surveillance cameras.

Tips.title: Assertive Language
Tips.description: Implies a decisive or aggressive action.
Tips.example: The squad plans to take out the enemy fort at dawn.

senses.de: To borrow something from a place such as a library
senses.ex: He decided to take out a few books to read over the weekend.

Tips.title: Library Visits
Tips.description: Typically used when referring to checking out materials from a library.
Tips.example: You can take out six books at a time with your library card.

senses.de: To arrange to get something, especially a loan, an insurance policy, etc.
senses.ex: We're planning to take out a mortgage to buy a house.

Tips.title: Financial Decisions
Tips.description: Relates to important financial choices, often requiring careful consideration.
Tips.example: They had to take out a larger loan to cover the renovation costs.

senses.de: To go to a place like a restaurant, theater, etc. with someone you have invited
senses.ex: He offered to take me out for dinner.

Tips.title: Special Occasions
Tips.description: Used when someone is treated to an outing, often implies a treat or celebration.
Tips.example: For your birthday, I'll take you out to your favorite steakhouse.
